special_features: Commentary by Tom Baker, Elisabeth Sladen, Terrance Dicks, and Barry Letts
The Tunnel Effect - Graphic designer's explanation
Blue Peter feature on Robot set

notes: This was the first serial to feature Tom Baker as the Fourth Doctor.
Debut of new companion Harry Sullivan, played by Ian Marter.
Last story produced by Barry Letts.
First story for which Robert Holmes was the script editor.
Notable for being the first story recorded entirely on videotape.
Terrance Dicks drew inspiration from King Kong and Isaac Asimov's I, Robot.

in_universe_mythology: The Doctor's documents include a galactic passport and a card as a honorary member of the Alpha Centauran Table Tennis Club.
real_world_cultural_references: Sarah Jane Smith makes a comparison between Harry and James Bond.
The Doctor mentions the Titanic and its design.
Professor Kettlewell mentions Galileo and Copernicus.
locations: National Institute for Advanced Scientific Research (Think Tank)

continuity_notes: Fourth Doctor's debut with a new opening title sequence.
Brigadier's full name Alistair Gordon Lethbridge-Stewart revealed for the first time.
First mention of the Doctor's dislike for farewells.
Doctor offers jelly babies, as he would later in this incarnation.
TARDIS interior not seen until 'Planet of Evil'.

plot.plot_summary: After the Doctor's regeneration into his fourth incarnation, a series of robberies linked to a disintegrator gun lead UNIT to investigate a sentient robot, K1, created by Professor J.P. Kettlewell and manipulated by Hilda Winters and the Scientific Reform Society. As the robot battles with its programming, the Doctor must regain his senses and unite with Sarah Jane Smith and Harry Sullivan to solve the mystery and prevent the destruction of humanity.
